intro: Jussiaea greatrexii, commonly known as the Greatrex's willowherb, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pinkish to white flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and along the edges of water bodies. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in umbels. Jussiaea greatrexii is often found in nutrient-rich soils and plays a role in stabilizing aquatic ecosystems.
